bug.author: smk508
bug.description:
/kind bug What steps did you take and what happened: I tried to install Kubeflow 0.6.2 on an existing K8s cluster using kfctl. I generated the configuration using kfctl init and then kfctl generate all -V and got this error: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for kustomize: kustomize generate failed Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 400 with message: couldn't download URI https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6.2.tar.gz Error bad response code: 404 It seems that that manifest is not available for some reason (gives a 404 error). If I change the version number to 0.6.1 it downloads. Also, the kubeflow archive for 0.6.2 downloads. Environment:
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): kfctl version: (use kfctl version): 0.6.2 Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) GKE Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): 1.12.7-gke.25 OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): Ubuntu 18.10

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.93. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/smk508>@smk508</denchmark-link> thanks for reporting this I went ahead and created the v0.6.2 tag so that should be fixed. That said I'd recommend using the newer syntax <denchmark-code>kfctl init --config=<path to some file> </denchmark-code>
e.g. <denchmark-code>kfctl init --config=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/config/kfctl_gcp_iap.0.6.2.yaml </denchmark-code>
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jlewi>@jlewi</denchmark-link> . Thanks for looking into this. I can download the manifest now. I was also able to get it to work fine using the newer syntax.
